text.div:
Generated Narrative: ImplementationGuide ihe.pharm.mpd

IHE_MPD

The official URL for this implementation guide is: 

http://profiles.ihe.net/PHARM/ihe.pharm.mpd/ImplementationGuide/ihe.pharm.mpd

ImplementationGuide for IHE Pharmacy Medication Prescription and Delivery

name: IHE_MPD
title: Medication Prescription and Delivery (MPD)
description: ImplementationGuide for IHE Pharmacy Medication Prescription and Delivery

extension.valueMarkdown: Automatically added as a dependency - all IGs depend on HL7 Terminology
Automatically added as a dependency - all IGs depend on the HL7 Extension Pack

resource.name: 01A-Cefuroxime1500GenericExplicit
resource.description: 1A. Cefuroxime 1500mg (1.5g) powder for solution in a vial. Generic product, defined by attributes.

resource.name: 01B-Cefuroxime1500GenericConcept
resource.description: 1B. Cefuroxime 1500mg (1.5g) powder for solution in a vial. Generic product, defined by a code system (receiving system is expected to have access to the code system for additional attributes or display names).

resource.name: 01C-Cefuroxime1500Branded
resource.description: 1C. Cefuroxime 1500mg (1.5g) powder for solution in a vial. Branded packaged product, defined by attributes.

resource.name: 01D-Cefuroxime750Branded
resource.description: 1D. Cefuroxime 750mg powder for solution in a vial (5 vials per package). Branded packaged product, defined by attributes.

resource.name: 02A-ClotrimazoleCanifugCremolum
resource.description: 2A. Clotrimazole cream 10mg/g and 6 pessaries 100g. Branded packaged product, consisting of different medication items. Defined by attributes.

resource.name: 02A1-CanifugCremolumCreamItem
resource.description: 2A2. Clotrimazole cream (10mg/g, 1 tube of 20g) as part of Canifug Cremolum product (ISO IDMP manufactured item)

resource.name: 02A2-CanifugCremolumPessaryItem
resource.description: 2A1. Clotrimazole pessary (6 pessaries of 100mg) as part of Canifug Cremolum product (ISO IDMP manufactured item)

resource.name: 03B-VitaminBComplexBranded
resource.description: 3B. Milgamma N, B-vitamin complex. Branded packaged product, defined by attributes.

resource.name: 04-FirmagonBranded
resource.description: 04. Firmagon. Branded packaged product, defined by attributes, includes administration devices.

resource.name: 05A-Tilidin-Branded
resource.description: 05A. Tilidin (50mg), Naloxon (4mg) oral drops. Branded packaged product, defined by attributes. Unusual strength.

resource.name: 10-dispense-1
resource.description: Medication dispense fulfilling the first part of the order: 1 package containing 10 vials

resource.name: 10-dispense-2
resource.description: Medication dispense fulfilling the second part of the order: 3 packages containing 5 vials each

resource.name: 10-prescription-cefuroxime-singleline
resource.description: A prescription/request with one medication and changing dosaging. Uses 'actionable' tag. Cefuroxime sodium.

resource.name: 100-3-medication-prescription-request1
resource.description: A prescription item (MedicationRequest) that is a part of a three-item-prescription (42-day treatment cycle). Generic. Thalidomide 50mgx4 once a day before bed for 42 days.

resource.name: 100-3-medication-prescription-request2
resource.description: A prescription item (MedicationRequest) that is a part of a three-item-prescription (42-day treatment cycle). Generic. Melphalan 2mgx4 once a day for 4 days in the beginning of cycle.

resource.name: 100-3-medication-prescription-request3
resource.description: A prescription item (MedicationRequest) that is a part of a three-item-prescription (42-day treatment cycle). Generic. Prednisone 50mgx3 once a day for 4 days in the beginning of cycle.

resource.name: 100-multiitem-prescription-with-orchestration
resource.description: Multiitem prescription with RequestOrchestration. 42-day cycle treatment consisting of three medications that should start at the same time. Wrapped in a Bundle for better readability.

resource.name: 100-RequestOrchestration
resource.description: RequestOrchestration for the medication to be taken at the same time - in this case start at the same time.

resource.name: 200-multiitem-prescription-without-orchestration
resource.description: Multiitem prescription where items on the same prescription are not interdependent. Kept together by the same groupIdentifier.

resource.name: 300-2-medication-prescription-request1
resource.description: A prescription item (MedicationRequest) that is a part of a three-item-prescription (42-day treatment cycle). Generic. Thalidomide 50mgx4 once a day before bed for 42 days.

resource.name: 300-2-medication-prescription-request2
resource.description: A prescription item (MedicationRequest) that is a part of a three-item-prescription (42-day treatment cycle). Generic. Melphalan 2mgx4 once a day for 4 days in the beginning of cycle.

resource.name: 300-dispense-for-2-requests
resource.description: Medication dispense dispensing one combination product for two prescribed products (multiitem prescription)

resource.name: 300-multiitem-prescription-with-orchestration
resource.description: Multiitem prescription with RequestOrchestration. 2 products dispensable as 1 multiitem product.

resource.name: activity-resource
resource.description: Search on the resources that are linked to a RequestOrchestration - important to allow for example _revInclude

resource.name: doctor1
resource.description: Dr Meryl Ärztin - clinical oncologist

resource.name: Dosaging (model)
resource.description: Logical model for usage instructions for administring the requested product. Based on FHIR Dosage complex data type.

resource.name: group-or-identifier
resource.description: Single search that incides on both request.identifier or groupIdentifier

resource.name: IHE Medication
resource.description: Medication for clinical use cases. This could be a branded product or a generic concept, also allowing describing pack size and components of complex products.

resource.name: IHE Medication Prescription
resource.description: IHE Medication Prescription profile

resource.name: IHE MPD Order Receiver (server)
resource.description:
The CapabililtyStatement for the [Order Receiver Actor](volume-1.html#141111-Order-placer) expresses the compliance requirements for systems implementing the actor.
- using FHIR R5
- using json or xml encoding
 - using conditional update for [ITI-104](ITI-104.html)
 - using conditional delete for [ITI-104](ITI-104.html) if Remove Patient Option is supported
 - provide supported Patient profile for crosss-referencing for [ITI-104](ITI-104.html)
 - should use a security framework. Recommend [ATNA](https://profiles.ihe.net/ITI/TF/Volume1/ch-9.html), encouraged [IHE-IUA](https://profiles.ihe.net/ITI/IUA/index.html) or [SMART-app-launch](http://www.hl7.org/fhir/smart-app-launch/)

resource.name: IHE MPD Order Receiver (server)
resource.description:
The CapabililtyStatement for the [Order Receiver Actor](volume-1.html#141111-Order-Responder) expresses the compliance requirements for systems implementing the actor.
- using FHIR R5
- using json or xml encoding
 - using conditional update for [ITI-104](ITI-104.html)
 - using conditional delete for [ITI-104](ITI-104.html) if Remove Patient Option is supported
 - provide supported Patient profile for crosss-referencing for [ITI-104](ITI-104.html)
 - should use a security framework. Recommend [ATNA](https://profiles.ihe.net/ITI/TF/Volume1/ch-9.html), encouraged [IHE-IUA](https://profiles.ihe.net/ITI/IUA/index.html) or [SMART-app-launch](http://www.hl7.org/fhir/smart-app-launch/)

resource.name: IHE Pharmacy Order Filler Actor
resource.description:
The CapabililtyStatement for the [Order Filler Actor](volume-1.html#141111-Order-Filler) expresses the compliance requirements for systems implementing the actor.
- using FHIR R5
- using json or xml encoding
 - using conditional update for [ITI-104](ITI-104.html)
 - using conditional delete for [ITI-104](ITI-104.html) if Remove Patient Option is supported
 - provide supported Patient profile for crosss-referencing for [ITI-104](ITI-104.html)
 - should use a security framework. Recommend [ATNA](https://profiles.ihe.net/ITI/TF/Volume1/ch-9.html), encouraged [IHE-IUA](https://profiles.ihe.net/ITI/IUA/index.html) or [SMART-app-launch](http://www.hl7.org/fhir/smart-app-launch/)

resource.name: IHE Pharmacy Order Placer Actor
resource.description:
The CapabililtyStatement for the [Order Placer Actor](volume-1.html#141111-Order-placer) expresses the compliance requirements for systems implementing the actor.
- using FHIR R5
- using json or xml encoding
 - using conditional update for [ITI-104](ITI-104.html)
 - using conditional delete for [ITI-104](ITI-104.html) if Remove Patient Option is supported
 - provide supported Patient profile for crosss-referencing for [ITI-104](ITI-104.html)
 - should use a security framework. Recommend [ATNA](https://profiles.ihe.net/ITI/TF/Volume1/ch-9.html), encouraged [IHE-IUA](https://profiles.ihe.net/ITI/IUA/index.html) or [SMART-app-launch](http://www.hl7.org/fhir/smart-app-launch/)

resource.name: IHEMedicationDispensation
resource.description: MedicationDispense profile for capturing dispensation information based on a medication prescription.

resource.name: Medication - Characteristic
resource.description: Any characteristic of the medicinal product prescribed or dispensed (for example, price, textual package description, special program information, etc)

resource.name: Medication - Classification
resource.description: Medication classification/category. Allows the product to be classified by various systems, e.g ATC, narcotic class, legal status of supply, etc..

resource.name: Medication - Device
resource.description: Device, typically an administration device, included in the medicinal product.

resource.name: Medication - Product Name
resource.description: Name of the medicinal product. This is typically the name of a real product as registered. This element should not contain display names of virtual product concepts.

resource.name: Medication - Size of Item
resource.description: Size of a manufactured item or unit of presentation. For example, size of one vial in a package that may contain several vials.

resource.name: Medication - Strength substance
resource.description: Substance for marking the basis of strength. When the precise active ingredient is a salt, the strength is often provided for the active moiety (basis of strength).

resource.name: Medication - Strength type
resource.description: Strength type (e.g. concentration strength, presentation strength)

resource.name: Medication - Unit of presentation
resource.description: Unit of presentation, typically describing the smallest countable package item (e.g tablet, vial, ampoule, etc). Unit of presentation is also often used in describing pack size and the denominator of strength. If the size of presentation unit is relevant, it should be described in sizeOfItem extension.

resource.name: Medication dispensation (model)
resource.description: Logical model for medication dispensation (based on request or independently)

resource.name: Medication prescription (model)
resource.description: Logical model for medication prescription (or some other form of order)

resource.name: MedicationRequest - Off-label use
resource.description: Indicates that the order placer has knowingly prescribed the medication for an indication, age group, dosage, or route of administration that is not approved by the regulatory agencies and is not mentioned in the prescribing information for the product.

resource.name: MedicationRequest - Prescribed Quantity
resource.description: Total amount of product being requested. This may refer to number of packages when package size is indicated in Medication resource.

resource.name: Medicinal product (model)
resource.description: Logical model for prescribed/dispensed medication. The model is shared by statements, requests, dispensations, and treatment lines. Each of those may have different restrictions in FHIR profile.

resource.name: organization1
resource.description: An organization: clinic

resource.name: organization2
resource.description: An organization: pharmacy

resource.name: Patient (model)
resource.description: Logical model for patient (basic data relevant for this use case)

resource.name: patient1
resource.description: A patient: Thomas, born 1950

resource.name: patient2
resource.description: A patient: Emily, born 1990

resource.name: pharmacist1
resource.description: Mr Moon Farmatseut - pharmacist

resource.name: Practitioner (model)
resource.description: Logical model for practitioner (basic data relevant for this use case)

resource.name: practitioner1
resource.description: Dr Meryl Ärztin

resource.name: practitioner2
resource.description: Mr Moon Farmatseut

page.name: presc-use-case-1.html
page.title: Use Case 1: Order straight to dispense

page.name: presc-use-case-4.html
page.title: Use Case 4: Change dosage during treatment
